p: To determine which CD34 + cells demonstrated repopulation potential, we used colony-forming cell (CFC) potential as a surrogate. This required sufficient blood product to flow-sort CD34 Lo and CD34 Hi cells for in vitro assays. Only the mAPH product collected from Patient 3 was sufficient for this study. For direct comparison, we sort-purified CD34 Lo and CD34 Hi cells from a healthy donor mAPH product. Only CD34 Hi cells from the FA-A patient demonstrated colony-forming potential ( Figure 2A). In the healthy donor, CD34 Hi cells also demonstrated the majority of CFC capacity in comparison with CD34 Lo cells, and at much higher levels as compared to the FA-A patient ( Figure 2B). These data suggest repopulating capacity is restricted to CD34 Hi cell fractions, underscoring the need to preserve as many of these cells as possible for gene transfer processes.
